phrase.cizu_name: ace up one's sleeve(或北美 in the hole)

jx.jx_en_mean: a plan or piece of information kept secret until it becomes necessary to use it
jx.jx_cn_mean: 手中握有王牌；有应急妙计

lj.lj_ly: deciding to play her ace, Emily showed the letter to Vic.
lj.lj_ls: 艾米丽决定使出杀手锏，把信拿给维克看。

jx.jx_en_mean: On the verge of; very near to

lj.lj_ly: came within an ace of losing the election.

jx.jx_en_mean: A hidden advantage or resource kept in reserve until needed.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 锦囊妙计：隐藏的优势或资源，一直保存到需要时

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (denoting the & oq. one & cq. on dice): via Old French from Latin as 'unity, a unit'

entry.def: An ace is a playing card with a single symbol on it. In most card games, the ace of a particular suit has either the highest or the lowest value of the cards in that suit.

entry.tran: （在运动等方面）成绩超群的人，佼佼者
entry.def: If you describe someone such as a sports player as an ace, you mean that they are very good at what they do.

example.tran: 前一流赛车手斯特林·莫斯

entry.def: If you say that something is ace, you think that it is good and you like it a lot.
In tennis, an ace is a serve which is so fast that the other player cannot reach the ball.

example.ex: The American served three aces in the opening game of the set.
example.tran: 这位美国选手在该盘首局有三次发球直得。

entry.tran: 占绝对优势；占尽天时地利人和
entry.def: If you say that someone holds all the aces, you mean that they have all the advantages in a contest or situation.

example.ex: 'When I was an adolescent,' says a thirty-one-year-old man, 'I thought girls held all the aces.'
example.tran: “当我还是个毛头小伙儿时，”一个31岁的男人说，“我觉得完全是女孩子说了算。”

entry.tran: 秘藏的王牌;应急的绝招;锦囊妙计
entry.def: Something that is an ace in the hole is an advantage which you have over an opponent or rival, and which you can use if necessary.

example.ex: Our superior technology is our ace in the hole.
example.tran: 我们超众的技术是我们的法宝。

entry.def: If you come within an ace of doing something, or you are within an ace of doing something, you very nearly do or experience it.

example.ex: He was intent on murder and he came within an ace of succeeding.
example.tran: 他一心想杀人并且差点就得逞了。

means.word_mean: 1. the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number;

sentences.sentence: "he has the one but will need a two and three to go with it"

means.word_mean: 2. one of four playing cards in a deck having a single pip on its face
3. someone who is dazzlingly skilled in any field
4. a serve that the receiver is unable to reach

list.explanation: 秘藏的王牌，秘而不露的髙招

example.en: The lawyer's ace in the hole was a secret witness who had seen the accident.
example.zh: 那律师手中的王牌是一个目睹那次事件的秘密人证。

means.word_mean: ( 网球 )（对手接不到发球的）发球得分；爱司球

sentences.en: That is the third ace that he has served this match.
sentences.cn: 那是他在这场比赛中的第3次发球得分。

jushi.english: He served 15 aces in the match.
jushi.chinese: 他在这场比赛中发球得分15次。

jushi.english: She served and got an ace.
In card games, the ace often has the highest number of points.
jushi.chinese: 在纸牌游戏中,A牌常代表最高分数。
